bug.short_desc: Chrome deve tools plugin for qooxdoo

long_desc.thetext: It would be handy to have some kind of qooxdoo specific tooling the browser tools. Chrome offers a good way to integrate custom panes into the dev tools which we could use to give qooxdoo developers a better support. Everyone having an idea what we could integrate in such a tool, could add it here.

Here's a very early prototype for such an extension:
https://github.com/danielwagner/qx-chrome-devtools
It ties in to the Elements panel and displays some information about the widget associated with the selected DOM element (decorator name, CSS class names etc.). It also creates a global symbol '$w' on the console which references the widget.

I made chrome extension some time ago: https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/chrome-qooxdoo/kdobodfpjlfilfoojlmhfikkfmfmnelh
Shows Qooxdoo properties for a widget of selected dom node. And $q can be used in console to work with this widget.
Thats pretty cool. Do you plan to keep on the development of this plugin?

If only I find nice idea to implement. For now I can say that $q in browser console is extremely helpful.
